Firstly, an amoeba is a single-celled organism and breast cancer is a disease that occurs in multi-cellular organisms, specifically in mammary glands. 
Therefore, it is not possible for an amoeba to have breast cancer. 
Hence, the answer is (A) yes, amoebas are safe from breast cancer.

First, we need to understand what an amoeba is. An amoeba is a type of single-celled organism that can be found in water or soil. Therefore, it is not an animal or a plant, and it doesn't have organs like a human body. 

Breast cancer is a disease that affects the cells of the breast tissue, which is found in mammals, including humans. So, since amoebas are not mammals and they don't have breasts, it is safe to say that they cannot get breast cancer. 

Therefore, the answer is (A) yes, amoebas are safe from breast cancer.

Next, we must understand what breast cancer is. Breast cancer is a disease in which cells in the breast grow uncontrollably. It is the most common cancer in women worldwide and can also affect men.

First, we need to understand what amoebas are. Amoebas are single-celled organisms that can be found in water, soil, and in some animals. They do not possess any mammary glands or breast tissues which are the origin of breast cancer. Thus, they cannot develop breast cancer.

Secondly, we need to understand what breast cancer is. Breast cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the breast tissue. It primarily affects women, although it can also occur in men. The main risk factors for breast cancer include genetic mutations, age, personal or family history of breast cancer, exposure to estrogen, and being overweight.

Since amoebas do not possess mammary glands or breast tissues and are not exposed to any of the above risk factors of breast cancer, it is safe to assume that they cannot develop it. Therefore, the answer to the question is "yes," amoebas are safe from breast cancer.
